page.title: 14Wallington Police Station
page.content: It was built in 1915 AD and is situated in Stafford Road, Wallington. In June 1985 there were 45 men and 5 women police officers stationed at Wallington. On patrol, officers take with them a personal radio, handcuffs, a truncheon and notebooks for recording accidents and incidents. A normal day is divided into 4 reliefs; early, late, night and off duty(which can be called out if necessary). At Wallington there are 4 panda cars. They are used by in- dividual officers for patrolling larger areas of Wallington. There is also an area car which patrols the whole divi- sion. A police officer could be expected to deal with anything from murder to finding a lost budgie! The most prevalent crimes in Wallington are burglary and damage and thefts of motor vehicles. By Brandon Hill School
